intro: Hermannia racemosa, commonly known as the red-stemmed hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, reddish stems and produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Hermannia racemosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
